case_vignette: A 35-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department by her coworkers after a sudden onset of vision loss. She is a lawyer and lost 3 cases in the past week. Yesterday, she experienced weakness and paralysis of her left wrist. Past medical history is significant for acid reflux. Physical examination reveals 2/4 in reflexes and 5/5 in muscular strength in all extremities. She appears indifferent to her current situation and presents with a flat affect. Slurring of words is absent. CT without contrast and MRI of the brain are unremarkable.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I suddenly lost my vision, and yesterday I felt weak and couldn't move my left wrist properly.
Have you had any history of seizures or migraines?
No, I haven't had seizures or migraines.
Have you had any recent changes in your sleep patterns or stress levels?
I've lost 3 cases at work in the past week, which has been stressful.
Have you had any recent changes in your diet or exercise routine?
No changes in my diet or exercise routine.
Have you had any recent travel history or exposure to any new environments?
No recent travel or new environmental exposures.
Have you had any recent changes in your medication regimen?
I have a history of acid reflux, but no recent changes in my medication.
Have you had any recent changes in your work schedule or routine?
No changes in my work schedule or routine.
Have you had any recent changes in your family history or personal life?
No changes in my family history or personal life.
Final Diagnosis: Transient Ischemic Attack (TIA)
